intro: Littledalea tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan little dalea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapted to the cold and harsh conditions of its habitat. It has small, compound leaves and produces pea-like flowers that are often pink or purple in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
